alert.note: Alert for Malheur County (Oregon) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Boise (Southwestern Idaho and Eastern Oregon)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued June 13 at 9:42PM PDT by NWS Boise
info.description: ...Strong thunderstorms will impact portions of northwestern Ada, northwestern Boise, southwestern Valley, eastern Payette, Canyon, northwestern Owyhee, Gem, southeastern Washington and east central Malheur Counties through 1130 PM MDT... At 1042 PM MDT, Doppler radar was tracking strong thunderstorms along a line extending from 6 miles west of Ola to near Emmett to near Sand Hollow to near Pelican Point. Movement was east at 25 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 30 mph. pea size hail and brief torrential rainfall. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Strong thunderstorms will be near... Caldwell, Emmett, Middleton and Lake Lowell around 1050 PM MDT. Nampa, Ola, Sweet and Montour around 1100 PM MDT. Star, Horseshoe Bend, Eagle and Gardena around 1110 PM MDT. Banks, Meridian and Big Eddy around 1120 PM MDT. Northwestern Boise, Hidden Springs and Givens Hot Springs around 1130 PM MDT. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.25 IN MAX WIND GUST...30 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Torrential rainfall is also occurring with these storms and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways. Frequent cloud to ground lightning is occurring with these storms. Lightning can strike 10 miles away from a thunderstorm. Seek a safe shelter inside a building or vehicle.
